Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2010 01:09PM dfwgal wrote: Wow I am so impressed with how everyone is doing this month with the procedures. This has been the hardest part for me, worrying about the MX.  But with the information from all of you, I will be much more relaxed.  Thanks for sharing. Vis, take your pain medicine with FOOD.  That tends to help.  You do not need to hurt. Have a half a sandwich and take your pill.
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2010 04:00PM dfwgal wrote: Will keep sending prayers for all.  I am staying positive on being cancer free by Christmas.  I am having a L MX  with Diep so I am glad to hear it won't be as bad as I anticipated. All of you coming on after your procedures really helps me relax about the things to come. Thank you for sharing. Hugs to all.
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 20, 2010 04:22PM dfwgal wrote: Good luck to all this week.  I feel like Biker, the waiting is killing me and giving me doubts on my decisions. Then Iplay back all the reasons why I decided the MX was the right thing to do.  I really am just ready to get it out of me and move on in my life. From the information above, I may need to have Milk of Mag at the house so I don't have issues from the pain meds.  Vis, sorry you received more bad news, but the good news is it is now caught and can be treated appropriately. You may want to cut your hair short now to make adapting a little easier. Maybe start with shoulder length, then in a week or 2 go to a bob. Hugs to all my December sisters.
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2010 09:40AM dfwgal wrote: I hav emy new compression garment. It makes it a bit more comfortable to get around. Its from Countourmd style 27. Covers midthigh to shoulders. the bra area is comfortable and doesnt press on the noob. Only thing I am adjusting to is seeing the noob standing up perky like a 20 yo and the old boob hanging to the waist..lol ( I was a D before this so imagine the sag). Once the noob heals enough, the nipple will be added then the old boob will get lifted and shaped to match. Abdomen incision still sore but healing well. Belly button looks cute too. Once the swelling is all gone, I am thinking a 2 piece swimsuit will be in my future. After all this, I plan to show the world I have a beautiful body despite BC/MX.  I am new and improved :) Arlene, let me know if your sister is more comfortable with questions off the board and I can send my e-mail too. SK  hoping you lose the drains soon. I will dance for you. It feels so much better. Sending prayers to Jacquline and Paula that their recover is doing welll and hope to see them in the recliner brigade soon. HUGS to all my Dec Sisters!
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2010 03:52PM dfwgal wrote: My Mastectomy is scheduled for Dec 22.  Will be glad to get it over. :)
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2010 11:03AM dfwgal wrote: To all of you going this week for your procedures...  Prayers and an easy recovery blessings heading your way. :)
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2010 01:04PM dfwgal wrote: Laugh Addict- I hope you know it is perfectly normal to have the ups and downs thru this. We are here for you and you can always vent when you need. My best friend gave me a coupon for 7 pity parties. I can turn in a coupon for a whole hour of "poor pitiful me" and she will empathize and hug me. Once the hour is up, I have to focus on all the positives again. Sounds like today would be a good day for you to use a coupon. :) Talk about feeling silly-I have a bed sore on my butt from living in a jack knife position. It is in a position that is very hard to reach. So after a shower, I have to place a dressing with ointment on a chair, and with the help of a hand held mirror, lower myself onto the dressing to the sore. When you need a laugh, this of that visual.  LOL  All we can do is laugh at the little things that try to throw us off keel. I will send you a few extra prayers today and positive vibes for better days to come.
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Jan 3, 2011 10:49AM dfwgal wrote: Woo Hoo! Welcome to the world of recliners Paula.  Still waiting to hear from Jacq on how her procedure went.  Missing a breast is a concept to adapt to. I know I have a mound from the DIEP but it still doesn't seem like "my breast". I am still on egg shells about it until I know all the chances for it to die are gone. Not sure when the final blessing on it will be but remain hopeful. I made my follow up appointments for the BS and the PS. Will be more comfortable again after those. And I should be getting the final path report anyday on the mx tissue. Hugs to all.
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2010 11:34AM dfwgal wrote: Woo hoo! Finally out of the hospital and a part of the recliner brigade. Hospital was a little rough. After a few days of laying in bed I ended up with a small bed sore, also had a bout of breathing issues where I developed asome atelectasisis. ( Lungs would expand completely) Extra oxygen and movedment then on day 3 I was finally able to get up and out of the bed. Getting up got easier each time but walking like I am 100 years old. Left Mast looks good and the DIEP appears to be taking very well. Strong blood flow, nice color and edges are healing well. The abdomen is what hurts the most.  Hip to hip incision, and we had the muscles tightened while we were in there. BUt once healed I know things will be much much better.  Thanks for all the thoughts. Good Luck Jac and Paula. you day is appraoaching soon so warm thoughts in advance.  Hugs to all
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2010 03:42PM dfwgal wrote: Met with the PS today and all my drains are now removed!   I feel free (happy dance). So far the incisions are all healing very well. The transplanted tissue is nice and pink and edges healing. My abdomen is still the sorest area from the tuck. After the transplanted tissue, we tightened all the muscles so my abd is pretty flat now... think 20 year old belly. Also got a new compression garment to wear to move forward in healing. Sending hugs to all and waiting for the rest to join our recliner brigade.
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 20, 2010 05:45PM dfwgal wrote: Hello all, I just found this post and I am also a nurse. Being a patient is a bit of a strech for me, but I am working hard to be the patient. I had the Sentinel Node Biospy last week and did great hiding the fact that I was a nurse until they asked history stuff and I rattled of the medical terms. However, the nurse did great and continued on like I was a normal patient. I also promised not to be the worst patient. When all was said and done, they said I was a great patient. I think it was the drugs they gave me. :)
Posts.Title: Nurses with Breast Cancer Jo_Ann_K PatRN10

Posts.Content: Dec 22, 2010 03:51AM dfwgal wrote: Hugs to all...off to surgery and next you hear from me will be from the recliner :) Good luck and prayers to all.
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 28, 2010 08:27AM dfwgal wrote: Arlene, I had te DIEP on my left side. IT is awesome. I never have had any issues to date.  It was nice to just my own cells. And my breast size will be similiar to pre cancer. Since the DIep wasbeing done my PS said he could throw in a full tummy tuck for 2K more if I wanted. So I waent for it. Needless to say my only complaints are th ehip to hip incision pains. Bearable but worth than I anticipated  If you have questions on the DIEP just message me and I can tell you all about how mine is moving along.  I named my Left Mast with Deip amy new Noob. since it is a new boob with real tissue. :)
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer
